subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Mindfulness: Buddhism's Gift to Psychology
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Mindfulness: Buddhism's Gift to Psychology.

hook.text: Hospitals prescribe it. CEOs swear by it. Mindfulness is a 2,500-year-old Buddhist practice repackaged for modernity.

buildup.text: The Buddha taught 'sati' â€” awareness of the present moment â€” as a core meditation practice for ending suffering.

discovery.text: Jon Kabat-Zinn stripped the Buddhism from mindfulness and introduced it to Western medicine in 1979. It worked.

twist.text: Critics say secular mindfulness commodifies Buddhism. It sells calm without addressing suffering's root causes.

climax.text: Mindfulness shows how religious ideas travel: strip the theology, keep the technique, and sell it to stressed people.

punchline.text: Buddhism gave us mindfulness. The West kept the calm, dropped the wisdom.

quiz.question: Where does mindfulness come from?
options: The Buddhist practice of 'sati' or present-moment awareness
